name: Avoid using <cstdio> stream input output library (C++)
description: This rule will raise a violation when <cstdio> has been used
output:
Information provided on:
1. No of violations that occurred
2. Bookmarks in the source code where violation occured
rationale:
This includes file and I/O functions fgetpos, fopen, ftell, gets, perror, remove, rename, etc.
Streams and file I/O have a large number of unspecified, undefined and implementation-defined behaviors associated with them.
reference:
Standards Reference:
MISRA C++ 2008, 27-0-1: The stream input/output library <cstdio> shall not be used.
alternativeName: Ensure that you are not using <cstdio> library
